title:
Global $C^{1,\beta}$ and $W^{2, p}$ regularity for some singular
  Monge-Amp\`ere equations
abstract:
We establish global $C^{1,\beta}$ and $W^{2, p}$ regularity for singular
Monge-Amp\`ere equations of the form \[\det D^2 u \sim
\text{dist}^{-\alpha}(\cdot,\partial\Omega),\quad \alpha\in (0, 1),\] under
suitable conditions on the boundary data and domains. Our results imply that
the convex Aleksandrov solution to the singular Monge-Amp\`ere equation \[\det
D^2 u=|u|^{-\alpha}\quad \text{in}\quad\Omega,\quad u=0\quad \text{in}\quad
\partial\Omega, \quad \alpha\in (0, 1),\] where $\Omega$ is a $C^3$, bounded,
and uniformly convex domain, is globally $C^{1,\beta}$ and belongs to $W^{2,
p}$ for all $p<1/\alpha$.
